summary: This is an email chain from July 7, 2019, between FBI personnel discussing the execution of a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence. The email details the seizure of evidence including binders referencing victims, CDs/images of young girls, and plaster busts of female breasts. It also mentions plans to approach co-conspirators, serve grand jury subpoenas, and conduct victim interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of investigation, owner of searched residence
persons.context: The search warrant was executed at his Manhattan residence, and evidence was seized from his home.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: Author of the email detailing the search execution, evidence seized, and next steps in the investigation.

connections.description: Law enforcement colleagues communicating about the Epstein investigation and search warrant execution.
The FBI agent is investigating Epstein and led the search of his residence.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested, as reported in news articles from CNN and Daily Beast.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Manhattan Residence
events.description: FBI executed a search warrant at Epstein's Manhattan home, lasting until 6:30 a.m. on July 7, and seized numerous items of evidence.

events.title: Scheduled Court Date for Epstein
events.description: A court date was set for Monday, July 8, 2019, following Epstein's arrest.

keyFacts: The FBI executed a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence on the night of July 6, 2019, concluding at 6:30 a.m. on July 7, 2019.

Seized evidence included binders with labels referencing victims, CDs and images of young girls (some borderline child pornography), pictures of young girls on walls and scattered, and plaster cast busts of female breasts.
The FBI was in the process of approaching co-conspirators and serving grand jury subpoenas, with victim interviews planned to commence in the next few days.
Epstein's arrest was reported by CNN and Daily Beast on July 6, 2019, with a court date set for Monday, July 8, 2019.
The correspondence is an internal FBI email update on significant investigative developments following Epstein's arrest.
